trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app | Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app | Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to send push notifications to a Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app by using Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to send push notifications to a Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app by using Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, when a new item is added, your Mobile App backend sends a push notification to all Windows apps registered with the Windows Notification Service (WNS).
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, when a new item is added, your Mobile App backend sends a push notification to all Windows apps registered with the Windows Notification Service (WNS).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the App Service Mobile App quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the App Service Mobile App quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the quickstart tutorial [Create a Windows app](app-service-mobile-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the quickstart tutorial [Create a Windows app](app-service-mobile-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active [Microsoft Store account](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=280045).
trans-unit.target: An active [Microsoft Store account](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=280045).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Community 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Community 2013

trans-unit.source: Complete the [quickstart tutorial](app-service-mobile-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Complete the [quickstart tutorial](app-service-mobile-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: Create a Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: Register your app for push notifications
trans-unit.target: Register your app for push notifications

trans-unit.source: Before you can send push notifications to your Windows apps from Azure, you must submit your app to the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Before you can send push notifications to your Windows apps from Azure, you must submit your app to the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: You can then configure your server project to integrate with WNS.
trans-unit.target: You can then configure your server project to integrate with WNS.

trans-unit.source: Configure the backend to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Configure the backend to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Update the server to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the server to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Now that push notifications are enabled in the app, you must update your app backend to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Now that push notifications are enabled in the app, you must update your app backend to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Use the procedure below that matches your backend project type—either [.NET backend](#dotnet) or [Node.js backend](#nodejs).
trans-unit.target: Use the procedure below that matches your backend project type—either [.NET backend](#dotnet) or [Node.js backend](#nodejs).

trans-unit.source: .NET backend project
trans-unit.target: .NET backend project

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the server project and click **Manage NuGet Packages**, search for Microsoft.Azure.NotificationHubs, then click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the server project and click **Manage NuGet Packages**, search for Microsoft.Azure.NotificationHubs, then click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: This installs the Notification Hubs client library.
trans-unit.target: This installs the Notification Hubs client library.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Controllers**, open TodoItemController.cs, and add the following using statements:
trans-unit.target: Expand **Controllers**, open TodoItemController.cs, and add the following using statements:

trans-unit.source: In the **PostTodoItem** method, add the following code after the call to **InsertAsync**:
trans-unit.target: In the **PostTodoItem** method, add the following code after the call to **InsertAsync**:

trans-unit.source: This code tells the notification hub to send a push notification after a new item is insertion.
trans-unit.target: This code tells the notification hub to send a push notification after a new item is insertion.

trans-unit.source: Republish the server project.
trans-unit.target: Republish the server project.

trans-unit.source: Node.js backend project
trans-unit.target: Node.js backend project

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, [download the quickstart project](app-service-mobile-node-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#download-quickstart) or else use the [online editor in the Azure portal](app-service-mobile-node-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#online-editor).
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, [download the quickstart project](app-service-mobile-node-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#download-quickstart) or else use the [online editor in the Azure portal](app-service-mobile-node-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#online-editor).

trans-unit.source: Replace the existing code in the todoitem.js file with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace the existing code in the todoitem.js file with the following:

trans-unit.source: This sends a WNS toast notification that contains the item.text when a new todo item is inserted.
trans-unit.target: This sends a WNS toast notification that contains the item.text when a new todo item is inserted.

trans-unit.source: When editing the file on your local computer, republish the server project.
trans-unit.target: When editing the file on your local computer, republish the server project.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: Open the shared **App.xaml.cs** project file and add the following `using` statements:
trans-unit.target: Open the shared **App.xaml.cs** project file and add the following `using` statements:

trans-unit.source: In the same file, add the following **InitNotificationsAsync** method definition to the **App** class:
trans-unit.target: In the same file, add the following **InitNotificationsAsync** method definition to the **App** class:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from WNS, and then registers that ChannelURI with your App Service Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from WNS, and then registers that ChannelURI with your App Service Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the **OnLaunched** event handler in **App.xaml.cs**, add the **async** modifier to the method definition and add the following call to the new **InitNotificationsAsync** method, as in the following example:
trans-unit.target: At the top of the **OnLaunched** event handler in **App.xaml.cs**, add the **async** modifier to the method definition and add the following call to the new **InitNotificationsAsync** method, as in the following example:

trans-unit.source: This guarantees that the short-lived ChannelURI is registered each time the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees that the short-lived ChannelURI is registered each time the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you also have authentication enabled, make sure that the user signs-in before trying to register for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you also have authentication enabled, make sure that the user signs-in before trying to register for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Authenticate first](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/app-service-mobile-windows-quickstart/blob/master/README.md#authenticate-first) in the quick start complete sample.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Authenticate first](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/app-service-mobile-windows-quickstart/blob/master/README.md#authenticate-first) in the quick start complete sample.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer double-click **Package.appxmanifest** of the Windows Store app, in **Notifications**, set **Toast capable** to **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer double-click **Package.appxmanifest** of the Windows Store app, in **Notifications**, set **Toast capable** to **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **Save All**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **Save All**.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step in the Windows Phone Store app project.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step in the Windows Phone Store app project.

trans-unit.source: Your app is now ready to receive toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now ready to receive toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: More
trans-unit.target: More

trans-unit.source: Templates give you flexibility to send cross-platform pushes and localized pushes.
trans-unit.target: Templates give you flexibility to send cross-platform pushes and localized pushes.

trans-unit.source: [How to use the managed client for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-how-to-use-client-library.md#how-to-register-push-templates-to-send-cross-platform-notifications) shows you how to register templates.
trans-unit.target: [How to use the managed client for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-how-to-use-client-library.md#how-to-register-push-templates-to-send-cross-platform-notifications) shows you how to register templates.

trans-unit.source: Tags allow you to target segmented customers with pushes.
trans-unit.target: Tags allow you to target segmented customers with pushes.

trans-unit.source: [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#how-to-add-tags-to-a-device-installation-to-enable-push-to-tags) shows you how to add tags to a device installation.
trans-unit.target: [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#how-to-add-tags-to-a-device-installation-to-enable-push-to-tags) shows you how to add tags to a device installation.
